resources.CarInventoryManagement

Class Management

  • java.lang.Object
    • resources.CarInventoryManagement.VehicleManager

  •  class Management
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Management()
      Default constructor creates an ArrayList of Vehicle objects called vehicleDB.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Management

        public Management()
        Default constructor creates an ArrayList of Vehicle objects called vehicleDB. This ArrayList will serve as the runtime database.

    • Method Detail

      • getVehicles

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> getVehicles()
        Simply a way to retrieve the existing database held in memory.
        Returns:
        The ArrayList vehicleDB

      • addVehicle

        public boolean addVehicle(java.lang.String vin,
                 java.lang.String make,
                 java.lang.String model,
                 int year,
                 double price,
                 int mileage,
                 java.lang.String bodyStyle)
        Adds a car to the runtime database, (assuming all the fields validate correctly). This does not mean that the information will necessarily end up in the database file! The database file is only written upon exiting the program normally!
        Parameters:
        vin - The vin number of the new car.
        make - Make of the new car
        model - Model of the new car
        year - Year of the new car, can't be before cars were invented, in 1896.
        price - Price of the new car, can't be less than 0.00.
        bodyStyle - The type of car it is.
        Returns:
        True if the car was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • addVehicle

        public boolean addVehicle(java.lang.String vin,
                 java.lang.String make,
                 java.lang.String model,
                 int year,
                 double price,
                 int mileage,
                 int maxLoadWeight,
                 double lengthFT)
        Adds a truck to the runtime database, (assuming all the fields validate correctly). This does not mean that the information will necessarily end up in the database file! The database file is only written upon exiting the program normally!
        Parameters:
        vin - The vin number of the new truck.
        make - Make of the new truck
        model - Model of the new truck
        year - Year of the new truck, can't be before cars were invented, in 1896.
        price - Price of the new truck, can't be less than 0.00.
        maxLoadWeight - The maximum load rating in pounds of the truck.
        lengthFT - The length in feet of the truck.
        Returns:
        True if the truck was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • addVehicle

        public boolean addVehicle(java.lang.String vin,
                 java.lang.String make,
                 java.lang.String model,
                 int year,
                 double price,
                 int mileage,
                 int displacement,
                 java.lang.String type)
        Adds a motorcycle to the runtime database, (assuming all the fields validate correctly). This does not mean that the information will necessarily end up in the database file! The database file is only written upon exiting the program normally!
        Parameters:
        vin - The vin number of the new truck.
        make - Make of the new Motorcycle
        model - Model of the new Motorcycle
        year - Year of the new Motorcycle, can't be before cars were invented, in 1896.
        price - Price of the new Motorcycle, can't be less than 0.00.
        displacement - The displacement of the Motorcycle, can't be less than zero.
        type - The type of the motorcycle (Scooter, Touring, Street Bike, Bitchen, etc)
        Returns:
        True if the Motorcycle was successfully added, false otherwise.

      • deleteVehicle

        public boolean deleteVehicle(java.lang.String vin)
        Deletes a Vehicle from the runtime database, (assuming the Vehicle existed). See cautionary note on the addVehicle method.
        Parameters:
        vin - The vin number of the Vehicle to be removed from the database
        Returns:
        True if a Vehicle was deleted, false otherwise

      • search

        public int search(java.lang.String s)
        Given a vin number, attempts to locate the Vehicle in question in the runtime database.
        Parameters:
        s - A string that is the vin number of the vehicle being sought.
        Returns:
        The index of the matching vehicle, if found. Otherwise returns -1.

      • showPriceRange

        public java.util.ArrayList<Vehicle> showPriceRange(double lower,
                                          double higher,
                                          java.lang.String type)
        Allows filtering of the runtime database by a price range.
        Parameters:
        lower - The lower limit of the price range to be searched.
        higher - The upper limit of the price range to be searched.
        type - The type of results to return (car, truck, motorcycle or all)
        Returns:
        An ArrayList of Vehicles falling within the specified price range.

      • saveDB

        public boolean saveDB()
        Attempts to write the existing runtime database to the database file. The file will be overwritten, so hopefully this doesn't introduce any corruption.
        Returns:
        True if the database was successfully written, false if there was an IOException.

      • readDB

        public boolean readDB()
        Attempts to read in from the database file called Vehicles.txt and load each Vehicle's info into the runtime database.
        Returns:
        True if the file existed and the information was successfully read into the ArrayList vehicleDB, false otherwise.
